page.title: 16LONG GROVE HOSPITAL
page.content: The last of a complex of 3 major psychiatric hospitals to be built on the site at the turn of the century, Long Grove imitates its 'sisters' architecturally{(see Epsom entry for {the other two). { }The then{London County Council} bought up the Horton Estate farmland in the 1890's, & Long Grove was put up 1903_7. Today it is administered by the{Greater London Council. Ordnance Survey maps of the early 20th century refer to Long Grove as an 'asylum' _ a term which has fallen out of use. At the side of the hospital access road is an old 'parish stone', marking the boundary between Chessington & Epsom.
